programme.title: Un opéra pour un empire
programme.desc: Famous for its ghost, Opéra Garnier was a titanic construction project and showcase for the Second Empire. From 1852 to 1870, Paris became the capital of modernity. Behind the scenes, machinery, architectural details and legends, we look back at the building of the opera house designed by Charles Garnier. Directed by: Patrick Cabouat (France, 2020)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Sète, a family affair Overlooking the Étang de Thau to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south, Sète is a peninsula open to the world, welcoming men and women from all corners of the Mediterranean down the centuries. A crossroads for trade and historical culture, an inspiring town, vibrant with life! Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc:
Programme summary: vegan leather goods; adapting plants from far away in order to grow them in France; a visit to the Bambouseraie, a bamboo garden in the Gard; designing a flowering border for Jérémy.
Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Pistes vertes
programme.sub-title: Gonnes Girls/La Consigne/Phytoépuration/Un quotition plus vert
programme.desc: Claire and Gaëlle left their city life behind to manage an organic farm called Les Gonnes Girls. Aline created La Consigne, Normandy's first packaging-free grocery store. Discovery of phytopurification. Marion, an environmental consultant, gives us tips for a greener daily life. Presented by: Laurent Quembre.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Jouy-en-Josas, to visit the Toile de Jouy museum. The Argentinean chef Juan Arbelaez invites us into his kitchen, filled with a thousand and one flavours. Schiaparelli, the perfect combination of art and fashion through collections inspired by surrealism. The restorer Isabelle Pitre offers paintings and artworks all their original beauty. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.sub-title: Le miel de Girouxville
programme.desc: Honey from Girouxville Near Girouxville and Fahler in northern Alberta, Luc lends a hand to Paul Benoit, a beekeeper who got into honey production more than forty years ago. Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Montres Pierre Lanier/S.T. Dupont
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Ravioles de morilles et brousse de brebis
programme.desc: Morel mushroom and brousse sheep cheese ravioli, chicken stock with hazelnut oil The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: Des artistes, des créateurs, immersion dans la nature
programme.desc: Of artists and designers, an immersion in nature The corm is the fruit of the service tree, Éric Bordelet explains how he turns it into a French drink called "cormé". Just opposite the Sacré-Coeur in Paris, Europe's largest city farm is starting to come into being. Visiting the Parc de Sceaux. Don't panic: Leïla and Thierry's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Min Teke After two nights of high-altitude camping, the group and their guide Caroline, attack the second part of the ascent to the summit of Min Teke. 900 metres of climbing on an ice wall and snow-covered cliff-faces. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Cranberry-cinnamon brioche
To highlight the arrival at the newsagents of the Christmas magazine, Ricardo prepares the recipe that features on the cover: a festive cranberry-cinnamon brioche wreath.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Sept-Îles, protecting the seabirds
Just offshore from Brittany's Côte de Granit Rose, the Sept-Îles archipelago is a nature reserve that offers a safe haven for the largest population of seabirds in metropolitan France. No easy matter, when we know that between 1950 and 2010, the global seabird population declined by nearly 70%. Report by: Corentin Pichon.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.sub-title: Best of design
programme.desc: Best of design Behind the scenes at the Maison de la Radio, Paris. Style enjoys a breath of fresh air with the bucolic creations by designer Éric Schmitt. Paris, in the footsteps of Le Corbusier. Ceramic with decorative weaving thanks to the magical hands of Silver Sentimenti. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Risotto bianco et risotto à la betterave
programme.desc: Risotto bianco and beetroot risotto Caroline Dumas cooks a risotto bianco, and offers a range of different additions, and also presents a beetroot risotto. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Hélène and her three boys, Magdalen Islands During a trip to the Magdalen Islands, Hélène fell in love with island life. This is where she imagined seeing her three sons grow up and flourish. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with the Garde Républicaine. Shells of every description enjoy a new lease of life thanks to the expert fingers of Thomas Boog, interior designer and creator of decorative objects. Three essential addresses for sculpture-lovers. In the Pyrenees, the VillaCampa workshop manufactures exceptional skis made in wood. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Motu Mahana (Polynésie française) Découverte du marché artisanal du Motu Mahana, en Polynésie. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: Des artistes, des créateurs, immersion dans la nature

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
Heading for Toronto to catch and move a marmot!
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.sub-title: Chez les moines à Saint-Jean-de-Matha
programme.desc: At home with the monks in Saint-Jean-de-Matha Christian spends some time in Saint-Jean-de-Matha, a peaceful, boreal setting, with the Cistercian monks from the Abbaye Val Notre-Dame, Micheline Lanctôt, Pierre Thibault and the chef Arnaud Marchand, from Chez Boulay, the boreal bistro in Quebec. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.sub-title: Le jardin familial et moderne
programme.desc: The modern family garden Can a landscape gardener be happy with a plot measuring just 200 square metres? Simon Rüegg says yes. For his family he has organised each corner of his garden such that everyone enjoys it, making the most of it and feeling at home. And all that with style and elegance. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.sub-title: Citadelle de Blaye/Marc Hertrich et Nicolas Adnet/ Sandrine Pagny
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Blaye Citadel on the Gironde estuary. Welcome to the world of the interior designers Marc Hertrich and Nicolas Adnet, of the MHNA Studio. The go-to addresses in Paris for everything Chinese. Bewitching colours and shapes: with Sandrine Pagny ceramics become works of fantasy. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.sub-title: Le Tonnerrois
programme.desc:
The Tonnerrois
We join Pascal in the Tonnerrois region for a visit to age-old vineyards that survived phylloxera. Bruno grows sunflowers and lentils the healthiest way possible in his fields. An in-depth look at current initiatives aimed at helping us better understand of the living world. All about Flogny-la-Chapelle gougères.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Tales and legends of Haut-Doubs Once upon a time there was the Haut-Doubs, a land known for many tales, some of which are legendary. And when night falls, mysterious creatures invade the imaginations of Franche-Comté's inhabitants! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.sub-title: Spéciale mode
programme.desc: Fashion special Behind the scenes at the Grévin Museum. Encounter with Jason Basmajian, artistic director for Cerruti 1881, a Parisian fashion house with a Hollywood accent and Italian roots. Paris, in the footsteps of the designer Yves Saint Laurent. The feather obeys his every whim, Maxime Leroy, feather artisan. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
